properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 8 at 1:08PM EST until January 8 at 1:45PM EST by NWS Mount Holly NJ
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Northwestern Camden County in southern New Jersey...
Central Burlington County in southern New Jersey...

* Until 145 PM EST.

* At 108 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located over Ramblewood,
or 9 miles east of Camden, moving east at 45 mph.

HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow.

SOURCE...Radar and webcams.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

* This includes the following highways...
Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 29 and 47.
New Jersey Turnpike between exits 4 and 5.
Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4.
Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 3.

Locations impacted include...
Philadelphia, Camden, Gloucester City, Cherry Hill, Evesham, Mount
Laurel, Willingboro, Voorhees, Medford, Lumberton, Bellmawr, Mount
Holly, Riverside, Palmyra, Tabernacle, Shamong, Magnolia,
Presidential Lakes Estates, Brooklawn and Pemberton.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 1:45 PM EST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
